result.execSummary:
The defendant Ward Deverney Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No crimes to level of probable cause and successfully completes probation, will dismiss

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

AODA
Counseling

Count 1 Deferred Judgment for 2 years

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
# 1 - Rules of Supervision
# 2 - Revocation Summary
# 3 - Letter from M.D.

Defendant Ward  Deverney in court with attorney Zachary Paul Glascock.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @8:48 a.m.  Court calls 14-CF-159 and 16-CF-144.  S.W. from DOC appears.   S.W., duly sworn on oath testifies.  Ex. 1 - Standard Rules of Supervision.  State asks Court take judicial notice of revocation summary in Case #13-CF-219.   Ex. 2 - Revocation summary.  State has no further witnesses.  Ex. 1 and 2 offered by State and received.  9:19 a.m./Ward Deverney, Sr., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Ex. 3 - Letter from M.D.  Offered by Def.'s Atty. and received by the Court.  No further witnesses.  Def.'s Atty. makes argument.  Response by State.  Response by Def.'s Atty.  Court denies motion.  Def.'s Atty. makes record of objection.
for Modification of Conditions of Probation
for Modification of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Ward  Deverney in court and in custody with attorney Zachary Paul Glascock.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 13CF219, 14CF159 & 16CF144  @ 1:53 pm.   State gives plea agreement, Joint recommendation on 13CF219 on ct 1, ct 1 plea in 16CF144, withheld sentence 18 months probation. 16CF144 cost, DNA sample and surcharge 13CF219 6 months jail, time served and credit from working in jail with go to 16CF144 if revoked.  Atty Glascock heard on credit - 148 days credit on 13CF219 and 45 days credit on 16CF144.  13CF219 Sentence on Ct's 4 & 5.  State has received summary packet and no corrections.  Atty Glascock has received summary packet and gives statement in things in packet.  Atty Glascock heard on allegations in packet. State replys. Judge will not consider alleged sexual contact in report. State gives sentencing argument.  Atty Glascock gives sentencing argument. Def. makes statement. Court orders ct 4 90 days jail, 135 days credit time served, completed
ct 5  6 months jail, concurrent with ct 4, 135 days credit, completed.  Def. advised of postconviction rights. 
14CF159 & 16CF144 - 16CF144 - Waiver of preliminary examination filed.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Information Filed.  Atty Glascock has copy of information and waives reading. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charge and penalties.  Def. agrees in repeater.  Ct 1 Poss of THC 2nd repeater, no contest plea.  Ct 2 DRI. Def. advised of constitutional rights & JT rights.  Def. understands elements. Def. admits prior convictions. Atty Glascock is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct 1 Poss of THC 2nd, repeater. No additional recommendation.  Atty Glascock has no additional recommendation. Def. has nothing to say.  Court accepts plea agreement and orders on ct 1 withheld sentence 18 months probation, costs,  $250.00 DNA Surcharge and sample. Credit for 45 days if revoked. 
14CF159 Court will revoke Defer Judgment and on ct 1 withheld sentence 18 months probation, costs. No credit. 
Def. advised of firearm and voting rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.
Motion hearing on September 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ward  Deverney in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 13CF219, 13CM204, 14CF144, 14CF159 @ 10:04 a.m. Written agreement filed. 13CM204 - revoke DEJ, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA, Counseling as recommeded , cc. 13CF219 Dismiss and read in cts 1, 2, & 3, plead to cts 4 & 5, withheld sentence, 18 months probation, AODA, counseling as recommended, cc. State asks bond be forfeited. 14CF144 dismiss both cts w/out prejudice, stipulate bond forfeited. 14CF159 ct 1 DEJ 2 yrs, will dismiss if successfully completes. Ct 2 withheld sent, 1 yr probation, AODA, counseling as recommended, cc. Atty Laufenberg agrees. Def agrees, acknowledges plea quest. 13CM204 ct 1 - plea already taken, deferred judgment was revoked. 14CF159 ct 1 charge reviewed, guilty plea. Ct 2  charge reviewed, guilty plea. 13CF219 ct 4 charge reviewed, guilty plea, ct 5 charge reviewed, guilty plea. Court reviews constitutional rights. Court finds Def understands, pleas freely made and finds guilty.
Statement by Atty Laufenberg. State has complied with victim notification requirements. Nothing by Def. Court accepts agreement.
14CF144 - dismissed w/out prejudice. Bond forfeited to county. 13CM204 - Withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA, counseling, costs. 14CF159 ct 1 - Defer judgment 2 yrs- no crimes to p.c., successfully complete probation. Review 3/13/17 @ 1:00 p.m.  ct  2 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA, counseling, costs. 13CF219 cts 1, 2, 3 dismissed and read in. Cts 4 & 5 - withheld sentence, 18 months probation, AODA, counseling as recommended, costs. Arguments on bond forfeiture. Court forfeits bond to County, gives reasons. Postconviction rights. 
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 14CF159 State asks bond be amended to signature bond and cash bond applied to costs in other cases. Court so orders. Bond will have same condition.

Defendant Ward  Deverney in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 13CF219, 13CM204, 14CF144, and 14CF159 @ 11:20 am. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Bonds continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ward  Deverney in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 13CF219, 13CM204, 14CF144 and 14CF159 also called.  Waive right to preliminary hearing.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  14CF144 & 14CF159 matter set for preliminary.  Court explains right to preliminary  hearing.   Def waives right to preliminary .  Court accepts waiver.  Court finds probable cause in 14CF144 & 14CF159.  Information filed.  Waive reading of informations.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accept not guilty pleas.  Bonds will continue.  Bond forfeitures will be adjourn.  Balance of cases set for status  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Ward Deverney in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Ward Deverney in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 13CF219, 13CM204, 14CF144 & 14CF159.    On 14CF159 - Special appearance.  Complaint received. Waive reading.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Review on bond.  Arguments presented by Atty Laufenberg.  Response by State.  Rebuttal.  Court will reduce bond $1500.00 cash.  No use of alcohol.  Bond will cover all files.  14CF144 will be adjourned  Bond forfeitures will be adjourned until next hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
